sections.heading: accounts.If there has been no activity in a share account for one year, except for the posting of dividends, a credit union may impose a reasonable maintenance fee as provided in the bylaws

sections.text:
21-1785.Dormant accounts.

If there has been no activity in a share account for one year, except for the posting of dividends, a credit union may impose a reasonable maintenance fee as provided in the bylaws.

SourceLaws 1996, LB 948, ยง 85.
